newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli Gaza memorial sparks Israeli-PLO tension.
newsitem.headline: Israeli Gaza memorial sparks Israeli-PLO tension.

text.p: An Israeli memorial erected on Tuesday to a soldier killed in clashes with PLO police in September has enraged Palestinians, a PLO police commander and witnesses said.
They said the 1.5 metre (4.5 foot) high stone-memorial was erected on privately-owned Palestinian land in the southern part of the Gaza Strip in an area that is supposed to be under PLO jurisdiction.
"This is a clear provocation...We demand that the Israeli side remove it immediately," Major-General Abdel-Razeq al-Majaydeh, director-general of Palestinian security forces in Gaza, told Reuters.
An Israeli army spokesman said he was checking the report.
Majaydeh said Palestinian and Israeli officers could meet later in the day to discuss the subject.
Israel handed over most of the Gaza Strip to Palestinian self-rule in 1994 under an interim peace deal but its troops still guard Jewish settlements that have remained there.

Fifteen Israeli soldiers and 61 Palestinians were killed in September in gunbattles in the West Bank and Gaza triggered by Israel punching an entrance into a tunnel near Moslem holy shrines in Arab East Jerusalem.
